description.narrative: National Resilience Programme- Department of Disaster Management (DDM) Part Mainstreaming resilience and overall protecting human development progress from shocks and risk through Sendai Framework Implementation and Preparedness for mega disaster

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

description.narrative: 1. Progress towards establishment of monitoring mechanism for Sendai framework implementation 2. Gaps, strengths and constraints for mega-disaster preparedness in current allocation of mandates in Standing Orders on Disaster (SOD) are known to key stakeholders 3. Sex, age and disability disaggregation is institutionalized in GoB post-disaster data collection tools and protocols (equivalent to SP indicator: 1.3.1.1 Recovery plans and systems in place utilizing sex, age and disability disaggregated data and gender analysis) 4. Percentage of NRP-trained Government officials self-reporting utilization of gender-responsive recovery planning in their work, with reference to named programmes/project 5. Progress towards formulation and dissemination to key organizations of gender sensitive curriculum and training capacity on light search and rescue (SAR) 6. DRR inclusive social safety net – guideline and piloting results are in place. 7. No. of policy briefs on disaster risk reduction activities with people with disabilities disseminated to policymakers 8. Progress towards institutionalization Flood Preparedness Programme (FPP) utilizing gender-responsive messaging with volunteers [equivalent to UNDP SP indicator: Indicator 3.3.1.1 Existence of operational end-to-end multi-sectoral early warning systems (EWS) to limit the gender-differentiated impact of: a) Natural hazards b) Health shocks (e.g. pandemics) c) Economic crises d) Other risk factors]. 9. No. of people (disaggregated by gender, age and disability) benefiting from increased access to early warning information from FPP piloting. 10. Progress towards development of Model on Inclusive Social Safety Net Programme (SSNP) meeting disaster specific needs of women and enhancing disaster resilience. 11. Progress towards inclusion for Forecast-Based Financing/Action (FBF/A) within DDM operations. 12. Progress toward Development of Location Specific Dynamic Flood Risk model for up scaling. 13. Progress towards formulatio

comment.narrative: 1. 2 Points 2. 3 Points 3. No target set for 2020. Targets achieved in 2019. 4. 75% [To be measured in Mid/Final Evaluation-2021] 5. 5 Points 6. 1 Point 7. 1 Point 8. 5 Points 9. No target for 2020. 10. 1 Point 11. 2 Points 12. 2 Points 13. 4 Points 14. 20% population (Age, gender & disability) of the working areas at flood and earthquake prone location.

1. 1 Point. Initiated data processing and analysis for SFDRR monitor data feeding. Beside this, SFDRR monitoring & reporting issues was sensitized in several multi-ministerial meetings. 2. 3 Points. Around 850 people from Government officials, Journalists and DMC members at various level have been oriented on SOD 2019. Bangla and English version of SOD 2019 has been made available for wide range of stakeholders through disseminating 20000 copies of SOD 2019. Earthquake study findings was shared with DDM. 3. 2 Points (Achieved in the year of 2019). 4. To be measured in mid term and review in 2021. Activities were in progress; Developed discussion paper/ concept note on preparing national recovery strategy and capacity building. Number of stakeholder consultation meetings took place jointly with another project of UNDP. 5. 3 Points. Developed Gender sessions to include in existing Fire Service and Civil Defense (FSCD) training curriculum for Urban Community Volunteers and Flood Preparedness Volunteers. 6. 1 Point. Piloting activity is progressing at Kurigram and Jamalpur and regular progress reports are being produced for documenting best practices of Piloting of DRR inclusive social safety net. In addition, NRP DDM part contributed in developing EGPP++ Guideline for DDM. 7. 1 Point. In view to have two policy briefs in 2020, the sub-project through CDD has started implementing the piloting on disability inclusive DRR. DiDRR activities contributed in developing RRAP through as well as guideline/training module. 8. 5 Points. 1440 FPP volunteers developed. Formed volunteer groups in 20 Unions in two districts and developed operational guidelines based on which training provided. Developed Gender sessions to include in existing Fire Service and Civil Defense (FSCD) training curriculum for Urban Community Volunteers and Flood Preparedness Volunteers. Finalized volunteers list handed over to Unions. COVID Contingency plans developed both for DDM and MoDMR. 9. 0 Point. Reached around 20000 people. 20 Unions developed RRAP through CRA. Community people will be benefited using those RRAP. Trained FPP volunteers were engaged in disseminating warning messages, rescue and rehabilitation activities during flood 2020. 10. 1 Point. Based on technical guidelines, project participants were trained, and schemes were selected for implementation. 11. 2 Point. Formation of Task Force (as per SOD) for early action in progress. However, NRP facilitated National Disaster Management Advisory Committee (NDMAC) activation. 12. 2 Point. Developed the location specific Dynamic Flood Risk model and devised a framework for early warning dissemination. 13. 3 Points. 6 ward level contingency plans drafted. 960 volunteers out of 2000 trained. BC committees are activated following GoB Circular. 14. 0 Point. 6 ward level earthquake contingency plans have been drafted. 20 CRA and RRAP have been prepared at 20 Unions of FPP areas.
Key Results (Narrative): NRP DDM part contributed for finalization of National Plan for Disaster Management for 2021-2025 and its online publication. The Standing Orders on Disaster 2019 in English version published that unveiled by the Hon’ble Prime Minister of Government of the Bangladesh. These two vital policy documents set the tone and foundation for transformative change in DRM, also is ensuring wider access from the international and national stakeholders. Risk informed earthquake contingency plan engaged local community in planning process while around 1000 urban volunteer are found instrument to prepare earthquake preparedness progarmme. Addressing the limitation of accurate, timely and accessible early warning for better preparedness and response Flood Preparedness Progarmme are got momentum by testing Dynamic Flood Risk Model for reducing the loss and damage. Additionally, development of 1440 number with a more than 40% female engagement in response during the frequent monsoon flood bought the confident of vulnerable community in reducing loss and damage. The project started to pilot of DRR integrated social safety net scheme by EGPP which were developed based on RRAP for risk informed planning with a gender responsiveness and inclusion for reducing loss and damage from flood. This is value added initiative build the confident of local community and influenced policy stakeholders for transformational change that tried to leverage the SSNP for DRR for building community resilience. Empowering persons with disability through ensuring their effective representation at local DMCs, developed the capacity of DPOs for better access to early warning including their active participation in SAR recognized as an innovative approach for addressing the global theme of ‘Leaving no one behind’. The project supported ministry and other stakeholder for SFDRR monitoring and reporting through data availability and system development by the inter-ministerial mechanism.

1. 6 Points. Completed Sendai meeting Seminar with Parliamentary Standing Committee on SF Monitor, Sendai meeting Training on SFDRR monitoring and revised D-Form aligned with customized SFDRR monitoring indicators. 2. 3 Points. Completed Standing Orders on Disaster (SOD) revision, submission and getting approval. 3. 2 Points. Sex, age and disability disaggregation is institutionalized in GoB post-disaster data collection tools and protocols in D-Form through SOD 2019. 4. Not applicable for 2019. 5. 1 Point. Completed Multi stakeholder consultation on gender responsive SAR curriculum 6. 1 Point. Completed Review existing safety net (EGPP) guidelines. 7. 0 Point 8. 0 Point 9. 0 Point (Piloting programme initiated only) 10. 1 Point. Developed Technical guidelines on DRR inclusive SSNP 11. 2 Points. Directives on Forecast-Based Financing has been mentioned in revised SOD 2019. 12. No Target for 2019 (Target sets for 2020) 13. 4 Points. Formed and activated WDMCs, BC Committees, Volunteers Groups and conducted training for volunteers in working areas. 14. Not Available (will be available after Midterm Review)

N/A Project implementation kicked off in last quarter of 2018, target was not set for this year according to results framework.
However, Office setup, staff recruitment, steering and implementation committee formation and formally programme launching could be considered as target for inception phase.

Formation of joint programme steering committee, joint programme implementation committee was formed and Annual work plan was approved in the inception phase. NRP formally launched in mid of November 2018.

1. 1 Points (Carry forwarded from 2020 due to Covid19 impact) 2. 0 Points (No target set for 2021) 3. No target set for 2021. Targets achieved in 2019. Additionally, digitalization and socialization of D-Form are in progress. 4. 75% [will be measured through Mid/Final Evaluation-2021] 5.
